review.title: “Usher”
review.pros: Pros – Easy, interesting, lots of famous people come through
review.cons: Cons – Evening hours, almost every night

review.title: “Great place unnecessary stresses but overall good experience”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent benefits met a lot of wonderful people made a few friends. Opportunities for advancement although quite difficult.
review.cons: Cons – Horrible hours, worked throughout holidays and late nights. A lot of annoying internal quarrels and bickering within the department. Everyone needs to focus on their job and being professionals.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take control the entire department is a circus. Management does not know how to manage.

review.title: “A solid, respectable nonprofit”
review.pros: Pros – • comfortable environment where good work is appreciated and valued• amazing colleagues who are smart and take pride in their jobs• community focused institution that sponsors top tier programs
review.cons: Cons – • there are many layers of management that sometimes conflict and create multiple hoops to jump through on a project, sometimes wasting human resources to do so• full time non-manager positions are unionized, which might prohibit the incentive to excel or the ability to advance in one's career. turnover is low, which is fantastic, but promotions seem rare.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great institution, challenging work envionment”
review.pros: Pros – You will undoubtedly learn a great deal, as many staff members wear multiple hats. You will also have an opportunity to experience some top-notch cultural programming.
review.cons: Cons – Because many staff members wear multiple hats, the workload can often be burdensome and overwhelming. There also appears to be some disparity in recognizing staff achievements and awarding promotions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Reviews are an essential part of the growth process and should be conducted annually, if not bi-annually.

review.title: “Great People to Work With”
review.pros: Pros – Great people to work with, many organized staff members.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of communication between departments

review.title: “Camp Counselor, Fantastic Gymnastics”
review.pros: Pros – Easy Work with generally nice young girls looking to improve their gymnastic skills
review.cons: Cons – Administration tough on summer hires
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Grant some more freedom to staff

review.title: “fun summer”
review.pros: Pros – The staff at the 92nd Y are great people. Once you work for them, there are alot of babysitting opportunities.
review.cons: Cons – The work days are extremely long. Private camps pay much more. They are a bit disorganized and tend to waste time in meetings.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management should be more aware of peoples' personal lives. Do not assume people want to spend extra hours with coworkers.
